replies.msg:
Ian McGarry speaking in the Transfer Window Podcast: “I’ve heard, although can’t confirm, that Arsenal have made contact with Napoli through a third-party regarding Koulibaly."

Ian McGarry: “And also that Napoli got some interest in Kolasinac. So you could see the possibility of Kolasinac being offered to Napoli in part-exchange plus cash, although Di Laurentiis prefers cash for Koulibaly because he wants to strengthen his team up the Serie A table.”

He also adds that Koulibaly has informed Napoli of his desire to leave next month and make a move away from Serie A.

You can listen from the beginning for some background to the Koulibaly situation. 3:13 is where he talks about Arsenal interest.

“Koulibaly’s valuation is in excess of €65million [£55m].” Adds that United and Everton (Due to Ancelotti) are also interested.

Ian McGarry speaking in the Transfer Window Podcast: “I’ve heard, although can’t confirm, that Arsenal have made contact with Napoli through a third-party regarding Koulibaly."

Ian McGarry: “And also that Napoli got some interest in Kolasinac. So you could see the possibility of Kolasinac being offered to Napoli in part-exchange plus cash, although Di Laurentiis prefers cash for Koulibaly because he wants to strengthen his team up the Serie A table.”

He also adds that Koulibaly has informed Napoli of his desire to leave next month and make a move away from Serie A.

“Koulibaly’s valuation is in excess of €65million [£55m].” Adds that United and Everton (Due to Ancelotti) are also interested.

LEVERKUSEN TO RESIST VOLLAND OFFERS

Bayer Leverkusen will resist January offers for Arsenal target Kevin Volland, according to Sky Germany.

The Bundesliga club are hoping to plan with their vice-captain for the long-term and do not wish to sell the forward.

He has 18 months left on his contract and Gunners scouts have been to watch him a number of times recently ahead of a possible January move.
